Symbols.Seal: Official Seal of the Government of Bangladesh

History.Ancient Bengal: Known as Gangaridai, a bastion of pre-Islamic kingdoms.
History.Muslim Conquests: After 1204, led to the sultanate and Mughal periods.
History.Bengal Sultanate: An independent Bengal Sultanate was established.
History.Mughal Bengal: Wealthy Mughal Bengal, important in regional affairs, trade, and diplomacy.

British Era.Bengal Presidency: Bengal's administrative jurisdiction reached its greatest extent.
British Era.Eastern Bengal and Assam: Creation in 1905 set a precedent for Bangladesh's emergence.

History.Partition of Bengal: Bengal was divided during the Partition of India in 1947.
History.Liberation War: In 1971, led to the independence of Bangladesh.

Current Status.Secular State: First constitutionally secular state in South Asia in 1972.
Current Status.Supreme Court Reaffirmation: In 2010, the Supreme Court reaffirmed secular principles.

International Role.Middle Power: A middle power in the Indo-Pacific.
International Role.Language Significance: Home to the sixth-most spoken language in the world.
International Role.Muslim Population: Third-largest Muslim-majority population in the world.
International Role.UN Peacekeeping: Largest contributor of personnel to UN peacekeeping operations.

Political Structure: Unitary parliamentary republic based on the Westminster system.

Administrative Divisions.Largest Mangrove Forest: Hosts the world's largest mangrove forest.

Refugee Population: Hosts one of the largest refugee populations due to the Rohingya genocide.
Leadership in Climate Vulnerable Forum: Bangladesh has been a leader within the Climate Vulnerable Forum.
International Affiliations: Member of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation
Member of the Commonwealth of Nations
